metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3655 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in the Linux kernel in versions prior tov5.14-rc1. Missing size validations on inbound SCTP packets may allow thekernel to read uninitialized memory.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-91-generic - 5.4.0-91.102
linux-image-5.4.0-91-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-91.102
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-91-generic - 5.4.0-91.102
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-91-lowlatency - 5.4.0-91.102
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1050-kvm - 5.4.0-1050.52
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-91.102').
